posts.title: Why Timber Frame Construction Lasts Generations
posts.excerpt: Discover the ancient art of mortise and tenon joinery and why it creates structures that stand the test of time.
posts.author: Woodly Team
posts.content:
When you invest in a Woodly Co. light post, you're not just buying outdoor lighting — you're investing in a piece of craftsmanship that will outlast most modern construction.

## The Secret: Mortise and Tenon Joinery

For thousands of years, master craftsmen have used mortise and tenon joints to create structures that last centuries. This technique involves cutting a projection (tenon) on one piece of wood to fit precisely into a hole (mortise) in another piece.

Unlike nails or screws that can loosen over time, mortise and tenon joints actually get stronger as the wood seasons and tightens around the joint.

## Why It Matters for Your Light Post

Our 11×11 inch timber posts are built using these same traditional methods. Here's why that matters:

- **No metal fasteners to rust** — The joint itself holds everything together
- **Natural flexibility** — Wood expands and contracts with seasons; the joint moves with it
- **Repairable** — If damage ever occurs, traditional joinery can be restored

## Built for Alabama Weather

From summer heat to winter storms, our posts are finished with UV-resistant protective coatings that work with the natural durability of the timber frame construction.

Interested in seeing our joinery up close? [Visit our workshop](/contact) or [browse our gallery](/gallery) to see completed installations.

posts.title: Solar, Battery, or Electric: Choosing the Right Power for Your Light Post
posts.excerpt: Not sure which power option is best for your property? We break down the pros and cons of solar, battery, and hardwired electric light posts.
posts.author: Woodly Team
posts.content:
One of the most common questions we hear from customers is: *"Which power option should I choose?"* The answer depends on your property, your preferences, and how you plan to use your light post. Let's break it down.

## Solar-Powered Light Posts

**Best for:** Driveways, garden paths, and anywhere electrical access is limited.

Solar-powered posts harness Alabama's abundant sunshine to charge during the day and illuminate your property at night. No trenching, no electrician, no ongoing energy costs.

**Pros:**
- Zero operating cost after installation
- No wiring required — install anywhere with sun exposure
- Environmentally friendly
- Automatic dusk-to-dawn operation

**Considerations:**
- Requires 4-6 hours of direct sunlight daily
- Light output may vary in cloudy weather
- Battery replacement every 3-5 years

## Battery-Powered Light Posts

**Best for:** Shaded areas, temporary installations, or locations where you want full control over timing.

Battery-powered posts give you flexibility without the need for sun or electrical infrastructure. Simply swap or recharge batteries as needed.

**Pros:**
- Works in shaded locations
- Portable — can be relocated easily
- No wiring or solar panel positioning required

**Considerations:**
- Requires periodic battery changes or recharging
- Higher long-term operating cost than solar
- Best suited for accent lighting rather than primary illumination

## Hardwired Electric Light Posts

**Best for:** Primary lighting, security applications, or when you want maximum brightness and reliability.

Traditional hardwired posts connect to your home's electrical system, delivering consistent, powerful illumination night after night.

**Pros:**
- Brightest, most consistent light output
- No batteries to change or solar panels to position
- Can integrate with smart home systems and timers
- Ideal for security lighting

**Considerations:**
- Requires professional electrical installation
- Ongoing energy costs (though LED fixtures minimize this)
- Less flexibility in placement

## Our Recommendation

For most Alabama homeowners, we recommend **solar-powered posts** as the primary choice — our sunshine is reliable, and the installation savings are significant. For heavily shaded properties or security-focused applications, **hardwired electric** delivers the best performance.

Not sure which is right for your property? [Contact us for a free consultation](/contact) — we're happy to visit your site and recommend the perfect solution.

---

*Every Woodly light post is handcrafted using traditional timber frame joinery, regardless of which power option you choose. The craftsmanship stays the same — only the technology inside changes.*
